alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 4:12PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of western Morris, northeastern Hunterdon, Sussex, Warren, northwestern Somerset, eastern Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 445 PM EST... At 411 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from Skytop to Wind Gap. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Hopatcong, East Stroudsburg, Hackettstown, Wharton, Washington, Blairstown, Bangor, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Mendham, Stanhope, Pen Argyl, Hamburg, Netcong, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Peapack And Gladstone and Oxford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 303 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 33. Interstate 287 in New Jersey near mile marker 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
